instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCCSA_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCSA_S0_CPU? Main power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. This is NOT shorted to ground if it has a low resistance â€“ this is a common mistake people make. A chip that requires high power at a low voltage like a CPU or GPU will have a low measured resistance to ground..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no USB activity
threads.message:
Clean board.

All test done on bench outside MacBook casing.

I get  <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> at 0.9V but there is no USB activity.

Already tried known good clean ME bios and same problem.

Also tried different RAM.

Any pointers will be greatly appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no USB activity
threads.message:
VCORE should drop to approx 0.75V, when the board boots.
Did you try different RAM?
Should be good to use DDR3 test card also.

What the client said about fault appareance?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no USB activity
threads.message:
Already had tried different RAM, but just now also tried some other one and same thing.
Client said that USB ports started failing then later on did not start.

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no USB activity
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on USB data lines.
Maybe PCH got damaged by some external device.
